Summary

Biography

GENERAL: Previously played at Saint John Fisher College prior to transferring to The College of Saint Rose…Decided to attend The College because of the academic and athletic developmental opportunities…Named his family as the most influential people in his life…Enjoys fishing, working out, and listening to music in his free time…Listed James Harrison as an admired athlete because of his competitiveness as an undersized and undrafted player…Mentions that he owns and operates a property maintenance company…Son of Brianna and James Ward.

AT SAINT JOHN FISHER COLLEGE: Named Empire 8 Conference Rookie of the Year in addition to earning first team All-Conference and second team All-Region honors…Hit .359 as a freshman with 42 base hits including seven doubles, two triples, and six home runs.

HIGH SCHOOL: Helped the Spartans win the New York State Class A Baseball State Championship…Also played football for the Spartans, where he won a Section II title and was named a Class A All-State linebacker…Honored with the Marine Corps Distinguished Athlete Award.

No stats available for the current season.
